content.title: STEMI Criteria
content.statement: ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) is diagnosed by new ST-elevation at the J-point in 2 contiguous leads with cutpoints: ≥1mm in all leads except V2-V3 where ≥2mm in men ≥40y, ≥2.5mm in men <40y, or ≥1.5mm in women.

explanation.intuition: STEMI represents complete coronary artery occlusion causing transmural ischemia, which manifests as ST-segment elevation on ECG.
explanation.key_insight: STEMI requires emergent reperfusion therapy (PCI or fibrinolysis) - door-to-balloon time should be <90 minutes.
explanation.technical_details: ECG criteria also include new LBBB, posterior MI (ST depression V1-V3 with R waves), and de Winter T-waves as STEMI equivalents.
